summary: The 'Stamp Out Lyme Disease Act' proposes the issuance of a semipostal stamp by the U.S. Postal Service. Proceeds from the sale of this stamp will be directed to the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases to fund research on Lyme disease and related tick-borne illnesses. The bill cites the high prevalence of Lyme disease, difficulties in diagnosis, and the chronic effects experienced by some patients, emphasizing the need for increased funding for research. The stamp would be available for at least six years.
